;;游客在威尼斯里亚托桥拍照
;

;可供游客使用的床位数量;威尼斯;的主岛已超过常年居民人数作为;联合国教科文组织关于该城市世界遗产名录上的命运即将来临。

;

;目前，酒店和出租度假屋内共有 49,693 个旅游床位，而居民人数为 49,304 个。

;

;曾经的市中心作为一个强大的海上共和国，威尼斯的主岛自 1950 年代初以来已经失去了超过 120,000 名居民，原因是无数的问题，但主要是对大众旅游业的关注，导致该市的人口与挤满其广场的数千名游客相形见绌，每天都有桥梁和狭窄的人行道。

;

;Venessia.com 是一个激进组织，多年来一直致力于保护威尼斯的遗产，一直在跟踪历史中心的人口水平，并在屏幕上显示不断减少的数字。自 2008 年起，Morelli 药店橱窗里就出现了电子行情。

;

;去年夏天，居民人数首次跌破 50,000 人。

;

;“我们在自己的家里感觉像外国人，因为当你走在街上时，我们是少数。”Venessia.com 的负责人 Matteo Secchi 说道。 “时不时地，你会看到威尼斯人，你会远远地向他们致敬，但除此之外，你周围都是游客。”

;

;与此同时，Ocio，一个关注威尼斯住房问题的居民团体， 4月份，在马可波罗书店的橱窗里放置了一个电子收报机，显示该市可供游客使用的床位数量不断增加。

;

;“我们没想到，几个月内收报机上的数字该协会在其网站上的一份声明中表示：“超过了居民的收入。”联合国文化机构将把威尼斯列入遗产危险名单的建议提交联合国教科文组织世界会议。遗产委员会于周日在沙特阿拉伯首都利雅得启动。

;

;该机构;7月份;表示，由于从气候崩溃到大众旅游业的影响等一系列问题，威尼斯面临着“不可逆转”的损害，同时指出意大利在解决这些问题上“缺乏重大进展”。

;

;Ocio 集团表示：“尽管某些地区的[旅游床位数量]已经超过[居民]，但领先于[联合国教科文组织] 会议上，我们想强调酒店的不断开业和短期租赁监管的缺乏如何逐渐将这座历史名城转变为旅游胜地。”

;

;今年夏天威尼斯的游客全面回归继 2019 年底发生严重洪水和疫情扰乱旅游业之后。平均有 40,000 名一日游游客在高峰期涌入这座城市，促使威尼斯当地政府宣布从明年起将强制实行酝酿已久的门票。

;
;

;;相关：;;威尼斯 至从 2024 年起，针对一日游游客试行 5 欧元票务系统;

;
;

;5 欧元费用仅适用于游览这座城市一日的游客。据地方当局领导人称，此举的目的是阻止高峰期的一日游游客，以此保护城市的“脆弱性”和“独特性”。

;

;旅游业议员西蒙·文图里尼 (Simone Venturini) 表示，这项措施将威尼斯定位为“全球水平的开拓者”，并不是为了盈利，而是为了“在威尼斯生活、学习或工作的人和参观这座城市的人的权利之间找到新的平衡”。

;

;然而，塞奇担心这一举措会将威尼斯变成一个主题公园，而不是一个人们想要生活和工作的地方。他补充道：“威尼斯需要规范游客流量，而不是收取入场费。”

;

;联合国教科文组织世界遗产委员会的会议将持续到 9 月 23 日，不过目前尚不清楚何时会宣布有关威尼斯的决定.

;

;这座1987年被列入世界遗产名录的城市在几年内第二次受到黑名单的威胁。

;

; “我们不需要联合国教科文组织告诉我们我们处于危险之中，”塞奇说。 “我们几十年前就知道了。但也许被列入危险名单会让当局采取更多行动。”

;;利比亚东部强降雨引发洪水，建筑物和车辆受损。
;

;一场强大的风暴班加西红新月会负责人表示，过去两天，利比亚东部城市德尔纳发生严重洪水，造成 150 人死亡，预计死亡人数将上升至 250 人。

;

;视频片段社交媒体显示，当丹尼尔风暴袭击班加西、苏斯、贝达、阿尔马吉和班加西以东 150 英里的地中海城市德尔纳时，人们被困在车顶上。

;

;Kais Fhakeri红新月会表示：“我们记录到建筑物倒塌后至少有 150 人死亡。我们预计死亡人数将上升至 250 人。情况非常灾难性。”

;

;其他地区的死亡人数尚不清楚。

;

;德尔纳居民艾哈迈德·穆罕默德 (Ahmed Mohamed) 表示：“我们正在睡觉，当我们醒来时，我们发现房子被水包围了。我们在里面，正在试图出去。”

;

;利比亚国民军 (LNA) 发言人艾哈迈德·米斯马里 (Ahmad Mismari) 表示，失踪人员包括七名利比亚国民军成员。利比亚国民军由哈利法·哈夫塔尔领导，控制着分裂国家的东部地区。

;

;利比亚东部的Almostkbal 电视台播放的画面显示，严重的洪水冲毁了车辆。该频道还发布了苏塞和沙哈特之间道路塌陷的照片，沙哈特是被联合国教科文组织列为世界遗产的昔兰尼考古遗址所在地。

;

;目击者称德尔纳的水位已达到三米（10 英尺）。

; <利比亚东部议会宣布哀悼三天。的黎波里临时政府总理阿卜杜勒哈米德·德贝巴也宣布所有受影响城市哀悼三天，称这些城市为“灾区”。

;

;他的政府在利比亚东部几乎没有影响力，但德贝巴周日表示，他已指示所有国家机构“立即处理”受影响城市的破坏和洪水。

;

;德贝巴政府得到利比亚中央银行的认可，该银行向各地政府部门发放资金

;

;四个石油港口 - Ras Lanuf、Zueitina、Brega 和 Es Sidra - 从周六晚上开始关闭。

;;红火蚁
;

;一种入侵性非本地蚂蚁物种已在意大利定居，可能会一项研究警告说，随着全球变暖，红火蚁迅速从欧洲传播到英国。

;

;红火蚁，;Solenopsis invicta;，具有强大的刺痛，会损害农作物，并可能感染电气设备，包括汽车和电脑。

;

;蚂蚁被认为是;最具破坏性的入侵物种之一;，可以快速形成多个蚁后的“超级蚁群”。这些蚁群捕食无脊椎动物、较大的脊椎动物和植物，破坏本地植物，并在食物方面击败本地蚂蚁、昆虫和食草动物。

;

;红火蚁是 ;世界上第五大最昂贵的入侵物种;，通过人类贸易从其原产地南美洲传播到墨西哥、加勒比海地区、澳大利亚和美国，其中据估计，它每年造成的损失达 60 亿美元（48 亿英镑）。

;

;研究人员在意大利西西里岛锡拉丘兹市附近 5 公顷（12 英亩）的土地上发现了 88 个红火蚁巢穴。根据发表在《当代生物学》上的一项研究的遗传分析，入侵的菌落可能来自中国或美国。

;

;Roger Vila，进化生物学研究所;蝴蝶多样性与进化实验室首席研究员; 表示：“在该地区协调努力进行早期发现和快速响应，对于在这一新威胁失控地蔓延之前成功应对这一威胁至关重要。”

;

;该慈善机构 ;Buglife;表示，当土壤中的植物被进口到英国时，入侵的蚂蚁物种很容易传播，并呼吁政府禁止进口土壤。

;

;欧盟已禁止从英国出口土壤，但英国尚未采取对等措施来阻止进口，主要是通过园艺贸易。

;

;Buglife 的 David Smith 表示：“这是为居住在土壤中的非本地物种敞开大门。人们普遍担心这些非本地入侵蚂蚁物种，这是少数即将进入欧洲的蚂蚁物种之一。

;

;“我们可以采取一些措施来阻止这些入侵，但一旦入侵蚂蚁物种就在这里，很难根除。蚂蚁因传播速度快而臭名昭著。”

;

;在欧洲，此前曾在西班牙、芬兰和荷兰的进口产品中发现过这种蚂蚁，但它在欧洲大陆的野外生存却从未出现过。已确认。

;

;虽然欧盟已更新其“受关注物种”名单，将红火蚁纳入其中，但英国政府自英国脱欧以来尚未更新其名单，尽管专家呼吁担心新的入侵物种。

;

; p>;

;史密斯补充道：“我们对政府拖延生物安全措施感到越来越沮丧。”

;

;澳大利亚正在支出;耗资 4 亿澳元（2.05 亿英镑）消灭蚂蚁;，但政府已因未能采取足够果断行动消除该物种而受到批评。自 2001 年出现红火蚁以来，新西兰是唯一成功消灭该蚁的国家。

;

;红火蚁是一种喜热物种，但研究人员得出的结论是，它可以在大约欧洲的7%。

;

;在今天的气候下，欧洲一半的城市地区都适合它，包括伦敦、巴黎、罗马和巴塞罗那等大城市。随着全球变暖，非洲大陆将变得更适合该物种生存，并有助于其在欧洲的传播。

;

;地中海沿海城市最适合蚂蚁，其海港可以促进其传播。

;

;该研究的主要作者 Mattia Menchetti 表示：“公众可以在检测 ;S;; invicta; 方面发挥关键作用，因为它经常发生发现于城市及邻近地区。尽管需要专家的确认，但由于其疼痛的刺痛和巢穴的特征，可以检测到这种蚂蚁。”

;

;西西里岛的殖民地位于郊区的河口和自然公园中锡拉丘兹。研究人员认为，风助飞行蚁后从西北部的锡拉丘兹港抵达那里。该团队建议进一步监控该端口。

; Mon, 11 Sep 2023 23:22:01 +0800 Sara Sharif: Pakistani police recover five children from grandfather’s househttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/11/sara-sharif-pakistani-police-recover-five-children-from-grandfathers-house

;;Urfan Sharif、Sara Sharif 和 Beinash Batool 的合成图像
;

;Urfan Sharif 的五个孩子警方官员称，10 岁的女儿萨拉在萨里被发现死亡后，他与妻子和兄弟逃往巴基斯坦，巴基斯坦警方周一在搜查过程中发现了他。

;

;警方称。从谢里夫父亲位于北部城市杰赫勒姆的家中救回了孩子们。

;

;地区警官纳西尔·穆罕默德·巴杰瓦 (Nasir Mehmood Bajwa) 告诉《卫报》：“周一晚上，警方派出重兵突击搜查了谢里夫在杰赫勒姆的住所，并救回了孩子们。”五个孩子。他们都很健康，状况良好。”

;

;谢里夫抵达巴基斯坦一个月后，在英国拨打 999 报告说，他的女儿死在沃金附近霍塞尔的家中。

;

; p>;

;

;Bajwa说警察打破了大门的锁，进入房子并没收了闭路电视摄像机。他说，他们正在继续寻找谢里夫、巴图尔和马利克。巴基斯坦警方在搜查中突袭了 20 多处房产。

;

;谢里夫和巴图尔出现在亲戚上周向媒体发布的视频中。巴图尔是唯一发言的人，她说“萨拉的死是一起事件”，并且没有对她的继女或她的死亡情况发表任何其他评论。

;

;她接着说：“我们在巴基斯坦的家人受到正在发生的一切的严重影响。我主要担心的是巴基斯坦警察会折磨或杀害我们，这就是我们躲藏起来的原因。”

;

;谢里夫的父亲穆罕默德，;周末表示;正在就三人安全移交至巴基斯坦进行谈判英国当局。

; Mon, 11 Sep 2023 22:52:02 +0800 JFK assassination witness questions whether shooter acted alonehttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/sep/11/jfk-assasination-multiple-shooters-paul-landis
;;2023-09-11T13:53:37Z;
;
;;22 日德克萨斯州达拉斯总统遇刺前，约翰·肯尼迪和杰奎琳·肯尼迪坐在一辆敞篷总统豪华轿车中1963 年 11 月。
;

;一名前特勤局特工，距离 ;约翰·F·肯尼迪;前总统被枪杀时打破了数十年的沉默，使人们对调查暗杀事件的委员会所持有的单弹理论产生了怀疑。

;

;在纽约时报发表的采访中周末;时报;，保罗·兰迪斯 (Paul Landis) 解释说，他长期以来一直相信官方的调查结果，即李·哈维·奥斯瓦尔德 (Lee Harvey Oswald) 在杀死肯尼迪时是单独行动。

;

;但是，基于他当天所看到的事情之间的差异，兰迪斯告诉《泰晤士报》，刺杀事件和调查肯尼迪遇刺事件的委员会的报告，“我开始怀疑自己”。 “现在我开始怀疑。”

;

;兰迪斯对肯尼迪被杀的回忆肯定会让那些相信 1963 年 11 月 22 日在达拉斯被多名枪手杀害的已故总统火上浇油。然而，他的言论是在他发表这番言论之前一个月左右发表的。发布了一本回忆录——与他在暗杀事件后不久提交的两份书面声明不同，这无疑使美国历史上最黑暗的篇章之一笼罩在神秘之中。正如肯尼迪所说，当时他正在骑马，听到一连串枪声，一颗子弹从后面击中了总统。沃伦委员会召开会议审查调查得出的结论是，一颗子弹随后继续前进，击中了同行乘客、德克萨斯州州长约翰·康纳利的背部、大腿、胸部和手腕。

;

;正如《泰晤士报》指出的，主要原因是调查人员认为，这是因为后来在康纳利在医院周围移动的担架上发现了子弹。

;

;进入兰迪斯的新采访和他即将出版的回忆录，;最后的证人：肯尼迪特勤局特工在 60 年后打破沉默;。兰迪斯告诉《纽约时报》，他是发现这颗子弹的人，他记得在总统被送往医院后，这颗子弹被卡在肯尼迪座位后面的豪华轿车座位上。

;

;兰迪斯还告诉《纽约时报》，他不认为子弹进入肯尼迪背部太深，然后在总统被从车上移走之前“弹出”。兰迪斯说，由于担心有人会试图将它作为纪念品装进口袋，他接过子弹并将其放在担架上的肯尼迪旁边。

;

;“我立即意识到这是一个非常重要的证据。”据《泰晤士报》报道，兰迪斯说：“这很重要。” “我不想让它消失或丢失。所以，‘保罗，你必须做出决定’——我抓住了它。”

;

;2014 年意识到他引用的子弹回收位置与据《泰晤士报》报道，兰迪斯在沃伦委员会与多名官员进行了核实。他普遍受到怀疑，主要是因为他自己提交了两份书面声明。

;

;这两项声明都没有提到他发现了有问题的子弹，而且他报告说，在暗杀发生时只听到了两声枪响”，《泰晤士报》写道。

;

;兰迪斯坚称，在提交这些报告时，他处于休克状态，并且睡眠不足。他说，他预计这些报道会有错误和遗漏，因为他当时的重点是支持第一夫人杰奎琳·肯尼迪度过悲伤。

;

;公开表达他与肯尼迪遇刺官方叙述的矛盾并不是一个明智的选择。兰迪斯告诉《泰晤士报》，正如他漫长的等待所表明的那样，这是一个简单的决定。

;

;“我不想谈论这件事，”兰迪斯离开了联邦机构，其职责包括保护总统的安全。肯尼迪遇刺六个月后。 “我害怕。我开始思考，我是不是做错了什么？有人担心我可能做错了什么，我不应该谈论它。”

;

;《最终证人》将于 10 月 10 日上映。它的预定抵达距离拜登白宫指示国家档案馆;发布;大约 12,000 份与肯尼迪遇刺有关的文件 — 据 ;当时的一项新民意调查;。

; Mon, 11 Sep 2023 22:22:01 +0800 Greek minister resigns over death of ferry passenger allegedly pushed into seahttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/11/greek-minister-miltiadis-varvitsiotis-resigns-death-ferry-passenger

;;Varvitsiotis
;

; Mon, 11 Sep 2023 22:22:01 +0800 Intellectuals condemn Mahmoud Abbas’s ‘attempt to justify antisemitism’https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/11/intellectuals-condemn-mahmoud-abbass-attempt-to-justify-antisemitism

;;马哈茂德·阿巴斯在西岸
;

;数十位巴勒斯坦知名知识分子、艺术家和其他公众人物发表了一封;公开信;，谴责巴勒斯坦权力机构主席马哈茂德·阿巴斯的反犹太主义言论。

;

;在周日发表的一封信中，包括历史学家拉希德·哈利迪 (Rashid Khalidi)、政治学家达纳·库尔德 (Dana el-Kurd) 和著名商人萨姆·巴胡尔 (Sam Bahour) 在内的 96 人表示，他们“明确谴责道德和政治上的阿巴斯发表的应受谴责的评论，;最后公开传播信中说：“我们坚决拒绝任何淡化、歪曲或证明反犹太主义、纳粹危害人类罪或针对大屠杀的历史修正主义的企图。”< /p>;

;在对被占领的约旦河西岸执政党阿巴斯法塔赫成员的电视讲话中，这位 87 岁的老人表示，阿道夫·希特勒在大屠杀中杀害欧洲犹太人不是因为反犹太主义，而是因为他们的行为。社会中的“社会角色”，比如放债。

;

;阿巴斯说：“他们说希特勒因为是犹太人而杀害犹太人，欧洲因为他们是犹太人而憎恨犹太人。

;

; >;“不。有人清楚地解释说，他们与他们战斗是因为他们的社会角色，而不是他们的宗教信仰。”阿巴斯后来澄清说，他指的是“高利贷、金钱等”。

;

;上个月发表的评论被翻译成英文并于上周三由中东媒体研究发表后引起了国际轩然大波。阿巴斯的言论很快遭到美国、德国和欧盟的批评，指责他歪曲历史并宣扬反犹太主义陈规定型观念。由于这起事件，巴黎市长安妮·伊达尔戈剥夺了这位巴勒斯坦长期领导人的最高荣誉。

;

;尽管他在国际上被视为 20 世纪 90 年代奥斯陆和平进程的主要缔造者阿巴斯是法塔赫早期与以色列对话的倡导者，曾多次被指控反犹太主义。

;

;20 世纪 80 年代，阿巴斯住在莫斯科时写了一篇被多次揭穿的论文，声称犹太复国主义者与以色列人勾结。大屠杀期间的纳粹分子，自那以后他就与纳粹保持了距离。然而，多年来，他在公开和私下场合频繁发表反犹太主义言论。

;

;今年 5 月，巴勒斯坦总统提出将以色列与纳粹德国进行类比。 The year before, he caused international outrage after claiming Israel had carried out “50 Holocausts” against the Palestinians during a news conference in Berlin with the German chancellor, Olaf Scholz.

;

;Abbas's spokesperson, Nabil Abu Rudeineh, has condemned the “rabid campaign” against the Palestinian president, saying that the leader's position is “clear and documented, which is the complete condemnation of the Holocaust and the rejection of antisemitism.”

;

;Abbas – initially elected for a four-year term in 2005 – is ;deeply unpopular at home;. His Palestinian Authority is regularly accused of violently suppressing its critics, widespread corruption and collaborating with the Israeli security services against its own people. Since his Islamist political rivals, Hamas, seized control of Gaza in 2007 he has repeatedly refused to hold elections.

;

;“The Palestinian people are sufficiently burdened by Israeli settler colonialism, dispossession, occupation, and oppression without having to bear the negative effect of such ignorant and profoundly antisemitic narratives perpetuated by those who claim to speak in our name,” the open letter added.

;

;“Abbas and his political entourage have forfeited any claim to represent the Palestinian people and our struggle for justice, freedom, and equality, a struggle that stands against all forms of systemic racism and oppression.”

;The French actor and director Mathieu Kassovitz has said he was trying to be a “superhero” and impress his daughter when he had a motorbike accident that left him in hospital with serious leg injuries.

;

;Kassovitz, best known for his 1995 film La Haine and his role in the 2001 film Amélie, ;came off his bike after misjudging a corner on a training course;. His daughter was on a motorbike behind him with an instructor, and his wife and son also witnessed the accident.

;

;In an ;emotional and occasionally rambling Instagram post; from his hospital bed, he said: “I've been a dickhead for 30 years because I force myself to be one, I force myself to distance myself from reality and celebrity … I'm 56 years old, perhaps it's time I stop being a dickhead and realise there are people who love me.” Kassovitz added that he had been touched by the numerous messages of support he had received.

;

;In the video, Kassovitz's first thoughts are for the victims of the Moroccan earthquake. He then explains how he smashed up his ankle after ploughing into a security barrier.

;

;“I had a motorbike accident because I love motorbikes and I'm passionate about them. We had a great riding session. At the end of the day, the director of the school wanted to take my daughter for a first ride. He asked me to take the lead on the circuit.

;

;“In my head, I thought I'd play superhero for my daughter and I took a corner too wide and was afraid of coming off so I straightened up and crashed straight into the guardrail. Fortunately, only my legs were injured,” he said, adding: “I'm an idiot. I'm a bad motorcyclist.”

;

;The film-maker said doctors had told him he may have to have part of his leg amputated but surgeons had managed to save it.

;

;“I was very lucky. They put in a titanium rod. It's incredible what goes on in French hospitals. They take you by the hand and look after you. They are paid very little for what they do. But it's a source of French pride. We know why we pay our taxes,” he said.

; Mon, 11 Sep 2023 21:52:02 +0800 German economy ‘will shrink this year as part of eurozone slowdown’https://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/sep/11/german-economy-will-shrink-this-year-as-part-of-eurozone-slowdown-inflation
;;2023-09-11T11:48:47Z;
;
;;A train on the Oberbaumbrücke Bridge in Berlin, Germany.
;

;Germany's economy will shrink this year as part of a wider eurozone slowdown triggered by higher inflation and the dampening impact of rising interest rates, the ;European Commission; has warned.

;

;In its interim quarterly update, the commission said Europe's powerhouse economy would be the worst-affected major country in the 20-nation single currency bloc and would suffer a 0.4% contraction in 2023.

;

;Three months ago the commission was forecasting that Germany would grow by 0.2% this year but now it says the world's fourth biggest economy has been even more sorely affected by weaker consumer spending than it envisaged three months ago.

;

;While the growth prospects of other major economies – France and Spain – have improved modestly since the spring, the commission said the eurozone economy overall was now expected to expand by 0.8% in 2023, down from 1.1% previously. Growth in 2024 has been revised down – from 1.6% to 1.3%.

;

;The downbeat economic forecasts increase the chances of the European Central Bank ;calling a halt; to the steady tightening of policy that has resulted in its key interest rate rising from -0.5% to 3.75% in nine successive jumps.

;

;Growth in the 27-country EU for 2023 has also been revised down – from 1% to 0.8% – while inflationary pressure across Europe has eased slightly.

;

;“Latest data confirms that economic activity in the EU was subdued in the first half of 2023 on the back of the formidable shocks that the EU has endured,” the commission said.

;

;“Weakness in domestic demand, in particular consumption, shows that high and still increasing consumer prices for most goods and services are taking a heavier toll than expected in the spring forecast.

;

;“This is despite declining energy prices and an exceptionally strong labour market, which has seen record low unemployment rates, continued expansion of employment, and rising wages.”

;

;The commission said the sharp slowdown in the provision of bank credit showed higher interest rates were working their way through the economy. Survey indicators pointed to slowing economic activity in the summer and the months ahead, with continued weakness in industry and fading momentum in services, despite a strong tourism season in many parts of Europe.

;

;Inflation in the eurozone is expected to average 5.6% in 2023 compared with 5.8% in the spring. In the broader EU, inflation is forecast to be 6.5% rather than 6.7%.

;

;Paolo Gentiloni, the EU commissioner for economy, said: “The EU avoided a recession last winter – no mean feat given the magnitude of the shocks that we have faced. This resilience, most evident in the strength of the labour market, is a testimony to the effectiveness of our common policy response.

;

;However, the multiple headwinds facing our economies this year have led to a weaker growth momentum than we projected in the spring. Inflation is declining, but at differing speeds across the EU. And Russia's brutal war against Ukraine continues to cause not only human suffering but economic disruption.”

;

;Gentiloni said “prudent, investment-friendly” tax and spending policies should work in tandem with the efforts of central banks to tame inflation.

; Mon, 11 Sep 2023 19:52:01 +0800 EU ‘very worried’ about Swedish official Johan Floderus jailed in Iranhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/11/eu-very-worried-about-swedish-official-johan-floderus-jailed-in-iran
;;2023-09-11T10:25:09Z;
;
;; Ylva Johansson speaks during a press conference
;

;The European Commission has said it is “very worried” about the plight of a Swedish EU official who has spent more than 500 days in jail in Iran.

;

;Ylva Johansson, the home affairs commissioner, who was previously in charge of the work of the detained Johan Floderus, said every effort was being made to get him released as she spoke publicly for the first time on Monday since the veil of secrecy about his case was lifted.

;

;“I'm very sad.我很担心。 And this has been with me for such a long time now,” she said.

;

;Floderus was jailed in Iran 512 days ago but the identity of the EU official, who turned 33 in prison on Sunday, came to light only 10 days ago after a report in the New York Times.

; ;

;Until then his identity had been kept secret by Sweden and the EU on the grounds that quiet diplomacy was the best route to obtaining his release.

;

;Over the weekend, Floderus's family also broke their silence, urging the international community to help secure his release, and complaining that he had been forced to to on hunger strike to get telephone calls.

;

;The family also revealed that Floderus's first consular meeting was permitted only five months after he was incarcerated. They complained that the “unacceptable” conditions he was living under in prison including 24-hour lighting in his cell were “in violation of the UN-standard minimum rules for treatment of prisoners”.

;

;The family added that his “needs for adequate food rations, outside walks, medical checkups and much more are not respected” while his exposure to fresh air and sunlight was “restricted to only a few 30-minute breaks a week”.

;

;They said that “in blatant disregard of international guidelines” Floderus had spent more than 300 days in solitary confinement.

;

;Johansson told the Guardian Floderus had been on her team for two years but that he had moved to another team because he wanted to work for the EU delegation in Afghanistan.

;

;He was detained in April 2022 while travelling in a personal capacity with friends.

;

;“He was a very bright, very warm and an excellent person to work with. And of course, when you work close you also become friends,” said Johansson, speaking emotionally about her colleague during a press briefing on an unrelated matter.

;

;“He's been with me for almost two years.但当他在伊朗被捕时，他就不再是我团队的一员了。 But of course, we've been informed and I and my head of cabinet have been and are in very close connection with his family on a weekly basis,” she said.

;

;“Of course, my feelings my worries are nothing compared to the situation of Johan or the worries that his closest family are living with every day. Yesterday, was his birthday, this is his second birthday [in jail], and let's hope that we can have him home soon,” she said.

;

;The Swedish government had responsibility to get him home from Iran but it was being supported by the EU's high representative on foreign affairs, Josep Borrell, Johansson said.

;

;Floderus's family said in a statement published by the Swedish newspaper Aftonbladet last week that they were “deeply worried and heartbroken” by his detention.

;

;He had visited Iran on EU official business without incident but was detained after going on holiday there with Swedish friends, they said.

;

;His family said he was being held without formal charges at Evin prison in Tehran, where political prisoners and many detainees facing security charges, including Iranians with dual nationality, are jailed.
